title: Many-body Landau–Zener dynamics in coupled one-dimensional Bose liquids
title_cn: 一维玻色液体中的多体Landau–Zener动力学
abstract: The Landau–Zener model of a quantum mechanical two-level system driven with a linearly time-dependent detuning has served over decades as a textbook model of quantum dynamics. In their seminal work, Landau and Zener derived a non-perturbative prediction for the transition probability between two states, which often serves as a reference point for the analysis of more complex systems. A particularly intriguing question is whether that framework can be extended to describe many-body quantum dynamics. Here we report an experimental and theoretical study of a system of ultracold atoms, offering a direct many-body generalization of the Landau–Zener problem. In a system of pairwise tunnel-coupled one-dimensional (1D) Bose liquids we show how tuning the correlations of the 1D gases and the tunnel coupling between the tubes strongly modify the original Landau–Zener picture. The results are explained using a mean-field description of the inter-tube condensate wavefunction, coupled to the low-energy phonons of the 1D Bose liquid.
abstract_cn: 由线性时间相关失谐驱动的量子力学两能级系统的Landau Zener模型已作为量子动力学的教科书模型使用了数十年。在他们的开创性工作中，Landau和Zener得出了两种状态之间转移概率的非扰动预测，这通常可以作为分析更复杂系统的参考点。一个特别有趣的问题是该框架是否可以扩展以描述多体量子动力学。在这里，我们报告了超冷原子系统的实验和理论研究，提供了Landau＆＃8211; Zener问题的直接多体推广。在成对的隧道耦合的一维（1D）Bose液体系统中，我们显示了如何调整1D气体的相关性以及管之间的隧道耦合如何强烈地改变了原始的Landau＆＃8211; Zener图片。使用管间冷凝水波函数的平均场描述与一维Bose液体的低能声子耦合来解释结果。

title: Real-space observation of emergent magnetic monopoles and associated Dirac strings in artificial kagome spin ice
title_cn: 人造kagome自旋冰中出现的磁性单极子和相关狄拉克弦的真实空间观测
abstract: Magnetic monopoles have been predicted to occur as emergent fractional quasiparticles inside pyrochlore spin ice, a frustrated magnetic insulator. Experimental signatures of such emergent monopoles accompanied by Dirac strings have been detected by means of neutron scattering in reciprocal space in pyrochlore spin ice at sub-Kelvin temperatures, but their real-space observation has remained elusive. Here we report on direct, real-space observations of emergent monopoles and their associated Dirac strings in two-dimensional (2D) artificial kagome spin ice at room temperature using synchrotron X-ray photoemission electron microscopy. Magnetization reversal proceeds through the nucleation and avalanche-type dissociation of monopole–antimonopole pairs along 1D Dirac strings. This is in sharp contrast to conventional domain growth in 2D systems, providing a striking example of dimensional reduction due to frustration. The observed hysteresis, monopole densities and 1D Dirac-string avalanches are quantitatively explained by Monte Carlo simulations.
abstract_cn: 据预测，磁单极子会在烧绿的旋转绝缘体烧绿石自旋冰内部出现时出现的准准粒子出现。通过在开尔文温度以下的烧绿石自旋冰中的相互空间中的中子散射，已经检测到伴随狄拉克弦的这种新兴单极子的实验特征，但是它们的真实空间观察仍然难以捉摸。在这里，我们报告使用同步加速器X射线光发射电子显微镜在室温下对二维（2D）人造kagome自旋冰中出现的单极子及其相关的狄拉克弦的直接，真实空间的观察。磁化反转通过沿一维狄拉克弦的单极和反单极对的成核和雪崩型解离而进行。这与2D系统中常规域的增长形成鲜明对比，这是由于受挫而导致尺寸减小的一个引人注目的例子。蒙特卡洛模拟定量解释了观察到的磁滞，单极密度和一维狄拉克弦雪崩。</ p>

title: Thermal ground-state ordering and elementary excitations in artificial magnetic square ice
title_cn: 人造方冰中的热基态有序化和基本激发
abstract: Recent advances in nanotechnology allow model systems to be constructed, in which frustrated interactions can be tuned at will, such as artificial spin ice. The symmetry of the square ice lattice leads to the emergence of a long-range-ordered ground state from the manifold of frustrated states. However, it is experimentally very difficult to access using the effective thermodynamics of rotating-field demagnetization protocols, because the energy barriers to thermal equilibrium are extremely large. Here we study an as-fabricated sample that approaches the ground state very closely. We identify the small localized departures from the ground state as elementary excitations of the system, at frequencies that follow a Boltzmann law. We therefore identify the state we observe as the frozen-in residue of true thermodynamics that occurred during the fabrication of the sample. The relative proportions of different excitations are suggestive of monopole interactions during thermalization.
abstract_cn: 纳米技术的最新进展允许构建模型系统，其中可以随意调整沮丧的相互作用，例如人造冰。 方形冰格的对称性导致受挫状态流形中出现了长程有序的基态。 然而，在实验上使用旋转磁场去磁协议的有效热力学很难进行访问，因为热平衡的能量壁垒非常大。 在这里，我们研究了一个非常接近基态的人造样品。 我们发现，在遵循玻耳兹曼定律的频率下，与基态的微小局部偏离是系统的基本激励。 因此，我们将观察到的状态确定为在样品制造过程中发生的真实热力学的冻结残留。 不同激发的相对比例暗示了热化过程中的单极相互作用。

title: Built-in and induced polarization across LaAlO3/SrTiO3 heterojunctions
title_cn: LaAlO3 / SrTiO3异质结上的内置极化和感应极化
abstract: Ionic crystals terminated at oppositely charged polar surfaces are inherently unstable and expected to undergo surface reconstructions to maintain electrostatic stability. Essentially, an electric field that arises between oppositely charged atomic planes gives rise to a built-in potential that diverges with thickness. Here we present evidence of such a built-in potential across polar LaAlO3 thin films grown on SrTiO3 substrates, a system well known for the electron gas that forms at the interface. By carrying out tunnelling measurements between the electron gas and metallic electrodes on LaAlO3 we measure a built-in electric field across LaAlO3 of 80.1 meV Å−1. In addition, capacitance measurements reveal the presence of an induced dipole moment across the heterostructure. We foresee use of the ionic built-in potential as an additional tuning parameter in both existing and future device architectures, especially as atomic control of oxide interfaces gains widespread momentum.
abstract_cn: 终止于带相反电荷极性表面的离子晶体固有地是不稳定的，有望进行表面重建以保持静电稳定性。本质上，在带相反电荷的原子平面之间产生的电场会产生内建的电势，该电势随厚度而发散。在这里，我们提供了在极性LaAlO <sub> 3 </ sub>＆＃160;在SrTiO <sub> 3 </ sub>＆＃160;基板上生长的薄膜的内在潜力的证据，该系统众所周知在界面处形成的电子气。通过在LaAlO <sub> 3 </ sub>＆＃160上的电子气与金属电极之间进行隧穿测量，我们测量了LaAlO <sub> 3 </ sub>＆＃160;上的内置电场为80.1 ＆＃160; meV＆＃8201;＆＃197; <sup>＆＃8722; 1 </ sup>。另外，电容测量揭示了跨异质结构存在感应偶极矩。我们预见到，在现有和将来的设备体系结构中，都将使用离子内置电势作为附加的调整参数，尤其是当氧化物界面的原子控制获得广泛的发展势头时。</ p>

title: Simulations of efficient Raman amplification into the multipetawatt regime
title_cn: 高效拉曼放大到数兆瓦状态的模拟
abstract: Contemporary high-power laser systems make use of solid-state laser technology to reach petawatt pulse powers. The breakdown threshold for optical components in these systems, however, demands metre-scale beams. Raman amplification of laser beams promises a breakthrough by the use of much smaller amplifying media, that is, millimetre-diameter plasmas, but so far only 60 GW peak powers have been obtained in the laboratory, far short of the desired multipetawatt regime. Here we show, through the first large-scale multidimensional particle-in-cell simulations of this process, that multipetawatt peak powers can be reached, but only in a narrow parameter window dictated by the growth of plasma instabilities. Raman amplification promises reduced cost and complexity of intense lasers, enabling much greater access to higher-intensity regimes for scientific and industrial applications. Furthermore, we show that this process scales to short wavelengths, enabling compression of X-ray free-electron laser pulses to attosecond duration.
abstract_cn: 当代大功率激光系统利用固态激光技术来达到petawatt脉冲功率。但是，这些系统中光学组件的击穿阈值需要米级光束。激光束的拉曼放大有望通过使用更小的放大介质（即毫米直径的等离子体）实现突破，但到目前为止，在实验室中仅能获得60 GW的峰值功率，远低于所需的数PB级功率。 。在这里，我们通过此过程的第一个大规模多维单元中粒子模拟显示，可以达到数兆瓦的峰值功率，但只能在由等离子体不稳定性增长所决定的狭窄参数窗口中达到。拉曼放大有望降低高强度激光的成本和复杂性，从而使人们能够更广泛地使用更高强度的光子，以用于科学和工业应用。此外，我们证明了该过程可以扩展到短波长，从而可以将X射线自由电子激光脉冲压缩到10秒的持续时间。
